content.question:
A sociologist studying the difference in ages between husbands and wives obtained a random sample of 55 married couples. The mean of the husbands’ ages was 38.5 years with standard deviation 12.6 years. The mean of the wives’ ages was 36.9 years with standard deviation 12.4 years. The sociologist calculated the difference between the ages for each couple. The mean difference was 1.6 years with standard deviation 2.1 years. A matched-pairs hypothesis test will be performed to investigate whether the difference is significant.
Which of the following is the standard error for the test statistic for the hypothesis test?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction with numerator 12.6 squared and denominator 55, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator 12.4 squared and denominator 55, end fraction, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>12.6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>55</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>12.4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>55</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2.1 and denominator the square root of 55" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>55</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2.1 and denominator the square root of 55 plus 55, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>55</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>55</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 12.6 minus 12.4, and denominator the square root of 55" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>12.6</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>12.4</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>55</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 12.6 minus 12.4, and denominator the square root of 55 plus 55, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>12.6</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>12.4</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>55</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>55</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2.1 and denominator the square root of 55" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>55</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.5: Carrying Out a Test for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
